channel.title: What would happen?
channel.description: lets say you hook a camera up to a tv so that you can see everything you record while you record it, then point the camera so all it is looking at is the tv, what would project onto the tv?

item.title: What would happen?
item.dc:creator: @Evan1 Evan`
item.description:
@Evan1 wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:22, topic:154186”][quote author=Evan` link=topic=210645.msg1858812#msg1858812 date=1193877935]
/Fail i have a camrea it’s just gray and it broke my camera.
[/quote]

That’s ridiculous, it didn’t break your camera.[/quote]Well not broke it, it wouldn’t record.It says in the instructions “don’t point at tv may cause damage to the camera.”

Read full topic

item.title: What would happen?
item.dc:creator: @horcrux979 horcrux979
item.description:
@horcrux979 wrote:

THIS IS A REAL ANSWER!! IVE ACTUALLY DONE IT!!!

Well, if its a digital camera, there’s sometimes a little aimer thing before you start to record. When you do it, not recording or taking photos, the screen will turn colors and you well see a trail of the center “radicals”

Read full topic

item.title: What would happen?
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

Yes, so if you are ‘predominantly inattentive’ you’d have ADD, if you are ‘predominantly hyperactive’ you’d just be hyperactive, and if you have a combination of the two you’d have ADHD. Right? =\

Read full topic

item.title: What would happen?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“Rictoo, post:16, topic:154186”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=210645.msg1854055#msg1854055 date=1193686384]

3 if you have add
0.1 if you have adhd

Offtopic: There is no such thing as “ADD” and “ADHD” - they are two seperate names for the same disorder.
[/quote]

That isn’t true. ADHD is Attention Deficit HYPERACTIVITY Disorder, ADD is the same except without hyperactivity. So ADHD is basically a double whammy.[/quote]

Actually, no. There are 3 types of AD(H)D - predominantly inattentive, predominantly hyperactive and combined. Whichever group you fall into, you still have “AD/HD” “ADD” or “ADHD”, it depends what you want to call it. ADHD is largely considered incorrect, even though its still the most common everyday term. People are even starting to phase out these acronyms completely, preferring things like Hyperkinetic disorder. (But the DSM still calls it “ADD/ADHD”)

Read full topic
